entry.title: DevNTell - Blocktorch
entry.summary:
🌈 GM In this weeks episode of DevNTell, DAO member Gery Pollak presents an overview of Blocktorch: observability for the decentralized stack 🌟 Developer Spotlight Gery has 6 years experience working in business development at FAANG and investing in startups in central & eastern Europe as a VC. He is a self taught developer (CS50) who made his first steps in solidity development end of 2020 going through the likes of CryptoZombies, Ethernaut, DappUnivserity etc. Beginning of 2022 (at the time when he joined D_D 🙂 ) he started to work on Blocktorch together with his co-founder Amine who is a seasoned software engineer. 🔥 About Blocktorch Blocktorch's mission is to build an end-to-end web3 observability platform to support engineers building dApps, similar to what DataDog achieved for the cloud but with a focus on decentralized backend architecture Website: https://www.blocktorch.xyz/
Careers: https://blocktorch.notion.site/blocktorch-careers-d9ddd67145354aa7a6c90f38aa13e08a
Docs: https://docs.blocktorch.xyz/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/blocktorch
Gery's Twitter: https://twitter.com/GeryPollak
Discord: https://discord.com/invite/5PdvH58gbj
🎥 Presentation

entry.title: Hedera x DevDAO: Build Faster DApps with Predictable Fees
entry.summary:
Following our exciting announcement of sponsoring Developer DAO, I'd like to introduce Hedera and the developer relations team further 👋. Hedera is an open-source public distributed ledger that uses the Hashgraph as its underlying consensus algorithm. Hedera offers excellent performance, scalability, and sustainability with native token and data (consensus) services and EVM-compatible smart contracts. Further your Hedera knowledge by visiting the Hedera documentation, where you'll have the opportunity to dive deeply into core concepts about the network. The Developer Relations, Documentation, and Community team supporting the Hedera network consist of the following:

entry.title: Getting Started With Arweave
entry.summary: This DevRel post arose from my research on Arweave for the Eden Protocol. Eden Protocol is a Developer DAO project centered on talent management. We're developing artificial intelligence to match the right people to the right opportunities at the right time. BluePanda, CTO of Eden, asked me to research Arweave for permanently storing endorsement data on a blockchain. This data will be generated as a person is endorsed based on their performance on a project, so long-term storage and immutability are essential. Arweave was a natural fit because it met all the requirements for implementing this feature in Eden. The astonishing thing was how simple it was to put this into action. Thanks to Arweave's clear documentation. In this post, I will share the information I gleaned from that research.…

entry.title: A Gentle Introduction to Decentralized Storage
entry.summary: Hey, fren! gm. Recently, I worked on an NFT project that required IPFS for storing the NFT images and metadata. That sparked my interest in learning more about decentralized storage, which has fascinated me for a while now. So, today we're gonna learn about decentralized storage (let's call it DStorage for short) and some of the most popular DStorage protocols in this blog post. Let's dive in! What is DStorage? As its name implies, DStorage is a storage system that does not rely on a central server or authority. Unlike a centralized storage system managed and operated by a single centralized entity, a peer-to-peer network of user-operated nodes operates DStorage, each of which stores a copy of the data creating a resilient file storage-sharing system. The decentralization makes it much mo…

entry.title: How to Develop and Deploy Smart Contracts with Foundry & Openzeppelin
entry.summary:
Foundry is a blazing fast, portable and modular toolkit for Ethereum application development written in Rust. It consists of three components: Forge: Ethereum testing framework (like Truffle, Hardhat, and DappTools). Cast: CLI for interacting with EVM smart contracts, sending transactions, and getting chain data. Anvil: local Ethereum node, similar to Ganache or Hardhat Network. Why Should We Use Foundry?
Its speedy; no more wasted time while running tests. It allows you to write tests in Solidity, which minimizes context switching. Many testing features like fuzzing, console.log, and cheat codes give you more power and flexibility. Topics We Are Going to Cover in This Article Project setup How to install dependencies in Foundry (i.e., OpenZeppelin) Integrating Foundry with VSCode Writing…

entry.title: DevNTell - Supercluster Labs
entry.summary:
🌈 GM In this weeks episode of DevNTell, Kai Huang and Gov go over their project, Supercluster Labs 🌟 Developer Spotlight Kai has been in Product Management for the last 6 years, currently working as a PM for MetaMask. Kai Started working on Supercluster about 4 months ago with the team he formed at HackFS '22 with the goal to provide a super easy decentralized file sharing application. Gov is a blockchain/web3 developer and researcher who has been in the space since 2014. He has worked on several projects in the space, notably at a venture funded project that developed secure p2p file sharing for governments. In addition, he has participated in several hackathons, notably creating a top 10 hack at HackFS 2020 and winning 2nd place for the IPFS prize at HackFS 2022. 🚀 About Supercluster Labs Supercluster is a decentralized file sharing solution purpose built for DAOs. Supercluster Files enables DAOs to share content between team members without having to rely on centralized parties. Website: https://www.supercluster.dev/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/superclusterdev
Notion workspace: https://buttered-ketch-b1b.notion.site/Supercluster-Labs-93c641213bd742dc9687e70c5d36e1bd

entry.title: Getting Started With SSX
entry.summary:
What Is SSX? "SSX is a library that enables you to easily add user authentication, session management, and more to your dapp." https://github.com/spruceid/ssx/blob/main/README.md
Okay, But What Is It? It's an app that allows you to administer authentication sessions for native Sign-In With Ethereum (SIWE pronounced see-we) and have a way to see stats on those sessions.
Why Is This Needed? Abstracting Functionality Could you build out your own user session manager with SIWE? Yes, you could, but like everything, why would you keep building the same tool systems repeatedly? Just like when services like Auth0 came into the market, we abstracted the need to try to build and manage authentication services. Easy Implementation It's also faster to get up and running with sessions without having …

entry.title: DevNTell - Biconomy
entry.summary:
🌈 GM In this weeks episode of DevNTell, Yashasvi Chaudhary gives us an overview of Biconomy: Biconomy is the ultimate toolkit to leverage smart contract wallets & build custom transaction journeys 🌟 Developer Spotlight Yashasvi is a blockchain developer whose been building in the Ethereum and L2 ecosystem for over 2 years. Currently he's building on Account Abstraction with Biconomy & learning ZK 🚀 About Biconomy Biconomy is the ultimate toolkit to leverage smart contract wallets and build custom transaction journeys. Biconomy has recently released a SDK that provides solutions from onboarding to user engagement for a decentralized application (dApp) in a non-custodial way. It is a one-stop solution to enable an effortless experience in your dApp as it eases onboarding for new users and abstracts away transaction complexities that your users face on a daily basis. This is enabled using Smart Contract Wallets (SCW) built on top of their multi-chain Relayer Infrastructure. source Website: https://www.biconomy.io/
Documentation: https://biconomy.gitbook.io/sdk/introduction/overview
Twitter: https://twitter.com/biconomy
🎥 Presentation
